description: From Old French hymnodie, from Latin hymnodia, from Ancient Greek ὑμνῳδία (humnōidía), from ὑμνῳδέω (humnōidéō, “I sing a hymn”), from ὕμνος (húmnos, “song of praise”) + ἀείδω (aeídō, “I sing”).

entries.meaning: (uncountable) The writing, composing, or singing of hymns or psalms.
(countable) The hymns of a particular church or of a particular time.
